primary.title: Primary color
primary.description: Primary color used in the website. For an optimal experience, it's better to use colors that play well with white fonts.

secondary.title: Secondary color
secondary.description: Secondary color used in the website, usually a darker version of the primary color. For an optimal experience, it's better to use colors that play well with white fonts.

appleTouchIcon192.title: Apple touch icon (192x192)

openGraphImage.title: Open Graph image
openGraphImage.description: URL of the image used in the og:image tag. This image is displayed when an Artifact Hub link is shared in Twitter or Slack, for example. The URL must use `https`.

shortcutIcon.title: Shortcut icon
shortcutIcon.description: URL of the image used for the shortcut icon (also known as favicon).

websiteLogo.title: Website logo
websiteLogo.description: URL of the logo used in the website header. For an optimal experience, it's better to use a white logo with transparent background, with no margin around it. It'll be displayed using a maximum height of 20px and a maximum width of 185px.

sampleQueries.title: Sample search queries used in home and no results found pages

siteName.title: Name of the site
siteName.description: This name is displayed in some places in the website and email templates. When a different value than the default one (Artifact Hub) is provided, the site enters `white label` mode. In this mode, some sections of the website are displayed in a more generic way, omitting certain parts that are unique to Artifact Hub.

imageTag.title: Tag used when pulling images

restrictedHTTPClient.description: Artifact Hub makes external HTTP requests for several purposes, like getting repositories metadata, dispatching webhooks, etc. When this option is enabled, requests to the private network space as well as to some other special addresses won't be allowed.
